page.title: 11The Sea
page.content: Much of the southern section of our survey area is taken up by the English Channel. Views over this area will always include vessels of various types. An abundance of yachts and other recreational craft, such as rowing boats and motor launches abound in the warmer months. Fishing vessels will be seen close to the shore lifting their lobster pots or setting their nets. Commercial shipping can be seen, including the Truckline Ferry Service between Poole and Cherbourg. Also the passenger ferry from Weymouth to Cherbourg or the Channel Islands may be sighted. Occasionally naval vessels will be seen using the nautical mile posts near Anvil Point to test their navigatioal instruments and their engines.
